LanguageData.ConceptText_MoveCamera: Move the camera by clicking and dragging the MIDDLE MOUSE BUTTON or with the WASD keys.
LanguageData.ConceptText_RescueColonist: To rescue a wounded colonist, select a healthy colonist and the right-click on the wounded one.
LanguageData.ConceptText_Capture1: An enemy has been incapacitated. You can capture them!
LanguageData.ConceptText_Capture2: To capture, select a colonist, right-click on the incapacitated enemy, and select Capture.\n\nYou'll need an extra bed marked for prisoner use.
LanguageData.ConceptText_Draft1: To control colonists directly for combat, Draft them by selecting them and hitting the Draft button.
LanguageData.ConceptText_Draft2: A drafted colonist will do only what you tell them, and can only take combat actions. Those with weapons will use them when possible.\n\nDon't leave colonists Drafted forever - they'll starve and become unhappy.
LanguageData.ConceptText_Forbid: Colonists will not interact with items marked FORBIDDEN.\n\nSelect the food and metal near your landing site and press F to UNFORBID them.
LanguageData.ConceptText_BillsTab: To make colonists work at a table, select the table and open the Bills tab. Here, you can say what meals to cook, what things to craft, what creatures to butcher.
LanguageData.ConceptText_GrowingFood: To grow food, place GROWING ZONES using the Architect menu.\n\nThey can only be placed on fertile ground.
LanguageData.ConceptText_BuildOrbitalTradeBeacon: Hint:\n\nTo send items or silver to orbital traders, you must build an ORBITAL TRADE BEACON outdoors and place a stockpile of items near it.
LanguageData.ConceptText_ReadingAlerts: If you're ever not sure what to do, check the ALERTS at the right of the screen.
LanguageData.ConceptText_CameraZoom: Zoom in and out with the MOUSEWHEEL or the T and G keys.
LanguageData.ConceptText_TimeControls: You can speed up, slow down, or stop time using the time controls in the bottom right.
LanguageData.ConceptText_PrisonerTab: Look in a prisoner's 'Prisoner' tab to set how they'll be treated.\n\nYou'll need a colonist with the Warden work to take care of the prisoner.
LanguageData.ConceptText_Mining:
You can designate where to mine using the ARCHITECT MENU.

Mining MINERALS yields METAL.

Mining ROCK yields nothing.
LanguageData.ConceptText_WorkOverview1: You can set each colonist's work settings in the OVERVIEW at the bottom right of the screen.\n\nThey will always do the highest priority work defName that they can find.
LanguageData.ConceptText_WorkOverview2: Colonists won't do jobs they don't have set.\n\nIf nobody has a certain work type assigned, it will never get done.
LanguageData.ConceptText_EquippingWeapons: To have your colonist equip a weapon, select the colonist and then right-click on the weapon.\n\nThere are weapons on the ground near your starting location.
LanguageData.ConceptText_HomeRegion: HOME REGIONS tell your colonists which areas to clean and where to extinguish fires.\n\nDefine a HOME REGION with the Zones category under the Architect menu.
LanguageData.ConceptText_StorageTabCategories: In the storage tab, you can expand categories to allow or deny specific items. Click the triangles to the left of category names.
LanguageData.ConceptText_StorageTab: You can configure stockpiles and storage buildings by selecting them and opening the STORAGE TAB above the bottom-left inspector pane.
LanguageData.ConceptText_SetGrowingZonePlant: You can set what growers in a growing zone. You can even grow trees!\n\nJust select the growing zone, open the Growing tab, and click the 'plant' button.
LanguageData.ConceptText_SpacePause:
Hit SPACE to pause or unpause the game.

You can give orders while paused.

Remember this - if things get hectic, just hit SPACE!
LanguageData.ConceptText_RightClickClearLetter: You can quickly dismiss incoming letters by right-clicking them.
LanguageData.ConceptText_OpeningComms: To communicate, select a working colonist and right-click on the comms console.
LanguageData.ConceptText_StoragePriority: You can change the PRIORITY of storage. Colonists will fill higher-priority storage first.
LanguageData.ConceptText_Wiki: You can look up information in the WIKI.\n\nUse the link the bottom right of the screen.
LanguageData.ConceptText_TradeGoodsMustBeNearBeacon: To send items or silver to orbital traders, you must build an ORBITAL TRADE BEACON outdoors and place a stockpile of items near it.
LanguageData.ConceptText_ArrestingCreatesEnemies: If you arrest someone, their entire faction will become your enemy.\n\nDon't arrest someone if you want to stay friends with their faction!
